text: A couple of bottles split with my father in law. This was an interesting experience -- I drank two bottles, and they were quite different. The first was sweet and a bit boozy, perhaps a bit more so than Id expect for a strong ale. The second was much more balanced with enough hop aroma to make it taste like an English IPA. It was so strange I had to do a double check of the bottles. Hard to rate because of the different experiences, but they both shared a classic English malt and yeast flavor profile.

Bottle, Tesco online. Amber, bright, white foam. A bit darker than I remembered...Charles Wells difference. Lovely rich balanced beer, sweetish bready malt with a hint of caramel and a robust spicy hop, hint of orange. Medium finish. Pretty good.

Bottle, 1 pint. Clearish orange with a frothy tan head and lively carbonation. Salty, grainy aromas of barley, biscuits, light toffee. Medium to robust bodied, fizzy carbonation. Dry and astringent. Lightly sweet, medium bitter. Malty and hoppy flavors into a stinging bitter finish.

Bottle. Bottled exactly 4 years ago! Still drinkable. Light copper, clear. Slight carbonation. Aroma delicate, floral, malty. Quite sweet, slightly sour. Malty. Bitterness stealthy and nice, provides a good lingering finish. Good mouthfeel. Too sweet for me, but quite drinkable nevertheless.

Botella en 99Cervezas.

De intensidad media en nariz, da inmediatamente notas de pan fresco, seguidas de un punto herbal, de manzana y suaves notas de lúpulo. Quizá también algo floral. Complejidad media.

Vierte en un precioso color dorado algo rojizo y totalmente transparente. Espuma media de un perfecto color blanco, con burbuja media-grande y persistencia moderada. Buena adherencia también. Una cerveza realmente agradable de ver.

De entre los sabores básicos, destaca en boca el salado, el amargo y el dulce a un tiempo. El salado desaparece rápidamente y el dulce va ganando importancia, aunque mantiene un buen equilibrio con un amargo muy suave y en absoluto agresivo o astringente. El pan vuelve a salir aquí. El conjunto es equilibrado y con un final dulce, pero no empalagoso.

En boca es de peso medio, algo sedosa y con una cierta sensación espumosa. De persistencia media, aunque el dulce parece acumularse con cada trago. Aun así resulta agradable. En todo caso, podría no ser la cerveza preferida de los que no les gustan con un final dulce.
Bottle. Light amber colour, large head that stays quite long, decent lacing. Aroma is clean malt, herbal hops, a bit of citrus. Medium bitterness. Well balanced, good one.

kolor: bursztynowy
aromat:owocowy (jasne owoce), estrowy, lekki alkohol
smak: wytrawny, zwietrzała beczka po jakimiś kiepskim alkoholu, drzewny, trochę owocowy białe śliwki, mirabelki, drzewno gorzkawy posmak średnio przyjemny, lekki nieprzyjemny alkohol, piwo z terminem 01.08.2014, leżakowanie mu nie służy
Fin maltsødme med smag af lidt tynde blommer. I engelsk stil ikke meget humle over den.

50cl bottle from local Alko, Viikki. This rather adventurous brew reminds me of saying: "One person with passion is better than forty people merely interested." -E. M. Forster. Not my style, but still an enjoyable beer.

Light amber pour with malt nose. Very pleasant light to mid crystal malt flavours throughout. Somewhat light spicy finish. Cant see where the 6.4% is. Tastes of a fairly straight and typical caramel malt English ale with slight marzipan and Christmas cake spice. Pleasant but not outstanding.
UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 Light amber smooth with hints of marzipan boozy warmth decent winter tipple very warming.

(Bottle) Pours clear amber brown with small white head. Pleasant aroma of caramel and bread. Medium body with good carbonation. Nice balance of flavours - some tartness balances some light caramel malty sweetness with some pleasant bitterness that develops later. Very drinkable, but not exceptional.
Light caramel aroma. Light taste of caramel, raisins. Pretty much thats all. Where is the "powerful spicy hop finish"? Another tasteless British Ale.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2016 Pours reddish hazy golden with a big white head; aroma is rich malty, slightly fruity, somehow grainy, herbal and hoppy; taste is medium to very sweet, malty and grainy, some honey, spicy and herbal hoppy with low to medium bitter finish; big creamy mouthfeel with medium carbonation and quite light body; very drinkable
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

La Special London Ale presenta un color ámbar oscuro, pero limpio y transparente. Produce al verter una amplia cabeza de espuma blanca con poca retención.

Huele a malta tostada, caramelo y especias picantes que también acompañan todo el rato en boca.

Se ataca de maravilla. Está bien carbonatada, con mucha chispa. Sabor dulce y terroso que va dando poco a poco paso a un amargo final elegante y agradable.

Una típica ale británica, con algo más de carácter y alcohol que las tradicionales pale ale, que nunca decepciona.

Bottle from Alcostock in Tallinn ( 2.3); BB 24.03.2017. Pours slightly cloudy golden amber with persistent creamy top. Modest malty aroma, slight yeasty spicy sweetness, perhaps hintingly buttery. Tastes malty sweet with leafy-herbal hops. Creamy soft mouthfeel, carbonation modest. Tingling herbal bitterish finish. Pretty nice.
Aroma: malty, caramel, bread, grass, herbs(?). Appearance: golden/amber, hazy. Taste: lightly bitter, light sweetness. Palete: medium body, average carbonation.
Clear light orange color with small white head. Malty and bread aroma with some light fruity and herbal notes. Light hoppy bitter taste with strong malt aftertaste.

0.5l bottle. Hazy dark golden color with small, but nice looking white head. Relatively high carbonation. Aroma of fruits, bread, malt and some herbal aroma, but all of that somehow weak. Taste is hoppy bitter and little sweet and sour. Slightly watery and no alcohol present, which is weird for ale with 6.4%.
Not enjoying this as much as I had hoped. Too much of a cloverhoney feel. Great for rhe palate, but it does make it too sweet.

Bottle
Aroma-bread, cereal
Appearance-amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 Belle orange/cuivrée, mousse faiblarde qui retourne vite fait de l?autre côté de la Tamise. Nez résineux bien agréable. En bouche c?est plutôt la débandade. Genre une pils en un peu plus caramélisée. Boarf.
Édit : en se réchauffant, ça tape plus dans le résineux en bouche, et du coup cest déjà plus plaisant.
Couleur ambrée, légère mousse blanche. Nez houblonné résineux, floral avec caramel. Gout caramel, houblonné bien épicé, mentholé, floral. Fin amertume florale herbeuse.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2016 Sessionable English ale. No big character, fruity, malty satisfying. Reminds me of a Dortmunder, silky malty and smooth. Not getting the spicy hop finish, but it?s alright. Would be cool to try it on tap in a pub, Im sure i?d rate it higher in that setting.
0.5l bottle thanks to Cristobal37. Orange body, off-white head. Aroma of bread, caramel and floral hops. Taste of bread, orange zest, caramel and spicy hops. OK beer.
Somewhat watery and tired. Crispy and dry with hints of fruity flavors at the finish.
500ml Flasche. Dunkelgolden und klar mit mittelgroßer Schaumkrone. Würzig. Blumig. Dezent herb und trocken.
500ml bottle from Asda. Pours slightly cloudy amber with deep frothy head. Aroma mostly malty with some fruitiness.

Barwa ciemnego złota, klarowne, bujna, drobno pęcherzykowa, ładnie zdobiąca szkło piana. Aromat zbożowy, chlebowy, trochę karmelowy. W smaku ziemiste, słodowe, nawet rześkie, czuć delikatny posmak chmielowy.

Grain and sweet bread malts, caramel, generic fruits. Clear, dark gold, medium, frothy, white head. Light sweet. More fruity malts, grain, caramel, soft carbonation, light bitterness coming up, some grass and floral hops. Nice ESA, somewhat one-dimensional, but stunning by Youngs standards. Bottle at The Alexandra, Wimbledon.

An english, amber English Strong Ale with white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, raisin. Taste is bitter sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle. "Serve at 10-12 degrees Celcius", so I leave it outside on a winter Sydney night and...voila! Nose is peppery sweet malt. Looks amazing, beautiful copper colour with solid white head. Fine and steady carbonation. Mouthfeel is surprisingly light, I expected a fuller body. Taste is clean and bitter. Finishes with caramel, fruit, biscuit, banana, bit of pepper and a late touch of alcohol. Wonderfully balanced beer.

Clear, copper coloured body and a creamy tan head. Aroma is slightly malty, some orange zest and spices. Clean, fresh taste, somewhat bitter but its pretty easy and doesnt hit you as hard with pale ales. Ends in a slightly malty finish. Slick mouthfeel, decent body, low carbonatin and very smooth. Quite nice ale overall.

Bottle from Bargain Booze, Whitby. Bright golden coloured with no real head. It has a sweet, floral melon, pine, toffee and passion fruit flavour followed by a gentle earthy and smooth caramel finish. Very good.
light metalich aroma,amber, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long light hoppy finish.

Low carbonation, minimal head retention. Malty caramel, detecting some banana. Slightly sweet, quite light on though for a 6.4%. Not much bitterness.
Medium body, thin texture got to say its not one Id buy again. Not bad...the candied fruit and touch of almost Christmas cake gives it a lift but...not totally sold on it.

Bottle 50cl. poured into a teku glass. Slightly hazy orange amber, tall creamy off-white head, good retention, heavy lacing; aroma sweet malts, caramel, orange, tangerine, yeast; fresh taste, medium sweet and bitter, fruity (orange, peach, raspberry) also retronasal, toffee, floral hops, light spicy notes; long duration becoming more and more bitter leading to a fruity sweetbitter finish, lingering light hoppy spices; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; very fresh, delicate and well-balanced, excellent.

Copenhagen 1/5 2016. 50 cl bottle from Føtex. A lot of Gibberish and a goat on the label. Pours slightly hazy orange amber with white head. Settles as patches of foam after a minute. Aroma is sweet and tart at the same time. Caramel meeting citric fruits. Fizzy carbonation and watery palate. Flavor is on the sweet side. Medium bitterness in the aftertaste. Not unforgettable but decent enough.

Served in a snifter from a 500ml bottle. Pours slightly hazy golden colour with a thick head leaving lots of lacing behind. Aroma is a complex combination of malt, caramel, bread, yeast, citrus hops. Taste is malts, caramel and citrus hops. Medium body with creamy texture. Absolutely wonderful stuff!!!
Bottle from Bilka. Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma and taste is malt, hint of caramel, fruits, spice. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Bittersweet finish.
Bottle. Both malty and hoppy. A bit heavy on alcohol taste. A very nice beer for lunch.
A golden medium-bodied ale, with almost no aroma, but it has a very good spicy hop flavour. Malty taste, with light sweetness and medium bitterness. Tasty and drinkable.

Aroma: fruity sweet with malt. 
Flavour: fruity sweetness with caramel and a dry bitter finish. 
Colour: brown amber with an offwhite head. 
From: Bilka Tilst Apr. 2016
Bottle from supermarket. Pours orange-amber with little head. The aroma is fruity, malty, with hints of caramel. Some hops in the finish. The taste is light to medium sweet with a nice bitter finish.

Bottle 0.5L.
Clear amber body with average, frothy, off-white head, mostly lasting with some nice lacing.
Moderate malty (caramel) and hoppy (some citrus) aroma with light notes of spices.
Moderate sweet flavour with light-to-moderate bitterness more evident in the finish.
Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2016 Solid as ever. Drinks faithfully to its 6.4% and slightly heavy malts drive some weight with toffee and baked fruits. Nice mineral and talcum powder streak running through the mid palate. It does, strangely enough, remind me a lot of SNs Torpedo. (Villa Market 170 baht)
Wszystko, co powinien mieć w sobie typowy, nieamerykański Ale. Słodowa podbudowa, niemal kremowa. I mnóstwo nieagresywnego chmielu. naprawdę klasyk.

Aroma: a bit faint and not very specific; some malts, some hops, a whiff of alcohol; a little bit like a German lager.
 Appearance: golden brown; clear; head large and stable.
 Taste: bittersweet, just a bit sour.
 Palate: body medium or below; carbonation average; mouth feel spicy; finish faintly bitter, a little spicy.
 Overall: nice enough, nothing special.

Bouteille. Nez malté de caramel doux et assez léger de toffee et de bonbon, de houblon herbeux et légèrement terreux et légèrement fruité (agrumes et abricots légers) avec de légères notes de noix. Mince-moyenne en bouche. Goût sec de malt légèrement croustillant (mais peu sucré) avec un pic amer de houblon terreux (floral avec très léger pamplemousse) avec un très léger goût fruité (agrumes, notes de cerises et dabricots) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût malté de caramel légèrement sucré qui tourne progressivement vers un malt légèrement plus rôti (toffee) puis finalement, une amertume de houblon herbeux revient sétaler jusquen arrière-goût avec des notes de noix. Arrière-goût court et sec, moyennement amer de houblon herbeux aux petites notes citriques. [notes 2006]
Clear amber, white froth. Malty aroma and flavour with light fruity and hoppy notes. A little spice and caramel as it warms up a bit.

Bottle @ Home. Pours amber with an creamy offwhite head. Aroma of sweet malt, sweet fruity hops, banana, sweet citrus, oranges. Flavor is light sweet, malty, caramel, fruity hops, sweet citrus, orangepeel. Medium body, light oily mouthfeel, average to lively carbonation. 210216

Pours crystal amber colour with a minimum head, which seems quite stable. Aroma is bery malty and sweet, also some gentle hops cam be sensed. Taste is very carbonated, very light bpdied at first, then a veru nice sweet taste runs through your mouth and finishes with a gentle hoppy finish.

Pours a beautiful copper color with big, creamy looking white head. Smell of malts, hops and fruits. Caramel as it warms up a bit.

Full body with low carbonation. Thick, oily texture. Lovely bitterness. Taste is malts, caramel, fruits. Finish is a bit dry and dominated by hops, spices and notes of alcohol, leaving a slightly hoppy aftertaste which is really nice.

Overall, very smooth.

500ml bottle from alko. Pours hazy orange with small creamy little tanned head. Aroma is malty caramel, little bit of yeast and some fruity notes. Really light sweetness, medium to heavy bitterness. Finish is nice and enjoyable. Nice texture, average carbonation. Remind me of bitters, good.

Fajna butla. Bardzo obfita i dosyć gęsta biała piana. Dosyć trwała. Piwo jasno-miedziane, klarowne. Lacing. Aromat słodki, trochę słodowy i estrowy, trochę kwiatowy. Piwo dosyć pełne, fajne ciało. Jest fajna, spora goryczka. Lekko rozgrzewający alkohol. Średnie nagazowanie. Sprawia wrażenie takiego kremowego. W smaku słodowe i trochę chmielowe. Generalnie słodkie.

0.5 l bottle from Alko. Amber clear colour with normal head. At first there is some sweet taste and maybe yeast. Also some bitterness. Basically this tastes like a strong bitter where alcohol rounds the taste a bit. You wont taste the high ABV, though, which is always a good thing.
Bottle from supervalue Sutton. Pours golden amber with white head. Aroma is bread sweet caramel, some fruity Esters. Malt forward flavour with full body and fruit aftertaste. Good

Bottle @ home. Pours with a glowing orange slightly cloudy colour, small but persistent white rocky head. Aroma is slightly to medium malty; medium hoppy, the kind of hoppy you dont expect from a "traditional" English brewer like this one: tropical, Pacific hops are here predominant, its quite a "modern" selection of hops; overall, quite a good aroma. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, slightly sour; balanced and refreshing, but still traditionally English in its malty side. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, hoppy (but not very bitter) finish. A modern look to traditional English ale, very well done I would say.
Bottle from Alko Hyvinkää. Golden with not much head. Fruity and alcohol. Round bitterness.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Barwa bursztynowa, lekko zmętniona. Aromat delikatny, troche chmielowy, troche owocowy. Smak karmelowy, dosyc alkoholowe.

Much lighter in colour than anticipated, but full of malty flavour. Relatively high alcohol level (above average anyway), but smooth and balanced. Easily drinkable, highly recommendable and definitely enjoyable.

Very large and lasting foam. The aroma is caramel malt, but the taste is not very malty flavor. The passes quite quickly to a pleasantly bitter taste with light fruit notes. Slightly malty flavor of dark bread arises towards the end, but it is most hops covering the taste. Lovely ale for long-term enjoyment.

Piwo zmetnione, ladna obfita piana. Barwa złota
Armat Słodki ciasteczkowy, w smaku po poczatkowej slodyczy kontra delikatnej goryczki. Wysycenie srednie
Uma Strong Ale bem equilibrada e saborosa. Mantém a tradição do estilo e representa muito bem a proposta do amargor.

Aromat: wyraźnie estrowy (śliwki, pomarańcze), słodki, słodowy (ciaskowo- karmelowy) z lekką nutą metaliczną.


Wygląd: barwa głębokiego złota do pomarańczowej, zgaszona. Piana w kolorze ecru, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, obfita i trwała.


Smak: wyraźna słodycz, posmaki drożdżowe, owocowe, herbatnikowe i spora chmielowa kontra. Jest też przeszkadzająca metaliczność. Goryczka w okolicach średniej, ale w połączeniu z metalicznością sprawia niemiłe, szczypiące wrażenie. Jest także zbyt długa. Średnia do krągłej pełnia, umiarkowane wysycenie i słodowy finisz. Mocno przeciętne.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2016 Ambra carico con ampio cappello di schiuma pannosa e molto persistente. Aroma di malto, note speziate e luppolate. Al palato malto e sentori erbacei. Buono il corpo e la carbonazione. Fresca e piacevole.

(Bottle, 0.5 l - BB 25/06/16, from Alko, 20150815) The beer poured amber and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had malts, earth and mildly caramel. Palate was medium carbonation with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, earth, grass, molasses, caramel and bitterness. Aftertaste had malts, earth and bitterness. A nice malty brew with rather strong English hop flavours.
Bottle. Ambery clear. Malty, slight sweet nutty, fine earthyness. Med bodied, malty sweets. Very flavourful. Malty.-- bb

Pours a slightly hazy amber color, topped with a quite decent white frothy head. Malty aroma, some caramel and bready notes, and some fruity feel as well. Taste starts with some sweetness, a bit of caramel and bread. Fair hoppy bitterness in the finish. Fine
Big long-lasting white head. Chrystal clear pale amber. Fruity aroma. Strong, malty, bitter, fudge.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Mökinjälkeiskalja. Whiplash ja vaari käymässä. Ihan ok keskitien kalja. Perus perus on tämä
A very hoppy taste, touch of bitterness that lingers on the tongue. Grassy taste with herbal traces, a spicy taste that appears a bit later. A very pleasant beer indeed!

Bottle from tesco, dudley. Slightly hazy Amber beer with medium head and patchy lacing. Aroma of malts, fruits and yeast. Taste is malts, caramel, dried fruit and some sweet cake. Medium to light bodied. Excellent stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Barwa pomiędzy złocistą a bursztynem, lekko zmętniona. Piana początkowo obfita, jasna, opadła do małej warstwy i tak pozostała. W aromacie dominują słody w połączeniu z chmielami. Początkowo wyczułem aromatyzowane mydło, z czasem doszły nuty kwiatowe. W smaku jest lepiej. Słody kontrują wyraźną goryczkę w kierunku wytrawnej (żywica, cytrusy). Wysycenie spore, podbite przez alkohol potęguje goryczkę i odczucie lekkiego szczypania na języku. 
Podsumowując. Całkiem dobre piwo!

50 cl, bottled. Pours clear slightly red orange with a pleasant white head. Aroma: Cotton candy, malt, fruits, hints of vanilla, Taste: Medium sweet, balanced bitterness. Malty flavours, some hops. More bitterness in the throat. Hints of caramel, maybe. Palate: Medium body, average carbonation. Very pleasant and somewhat sessionable ale. Pleasantly malty, P.S indeed it is better with slow pour leaving the yeast, tho still not bad, but it flattens the flavours, yet gives it a fuller palate..Not bad anyhow.
In my opinion, it is a good beer and a classical ale but it is more a kind I.P.A. The taste is bitter and the hop is present. The colour is a typical I.P.A copper colour.

Pours dark haze golden, almost dark amber, colour with tiny off-white head. Slow rising bubbles. 
Aroma without presence of an alcohol, with fruity notes of hops- esters- of oranges, avocado, plums, bananas...
Also you can detect fenol- cloves.
Taste is also without presence of an alcohol. Firstly dominate notes of malts. It is sweet, with bitter finish. Malt sweetness is medium, hop bitterness also. Body is soft mouth-coating.
Very good English ale.

Cask pour at Khyber Pass. Slightly hazy medium amber with a large frothy/soapy head. Gently carbonated. Medium bodied. Bready flavors with a modest amount of grassy floral hops. Croissants with apricot jam. Straw. Honeycomb. Golden plums. Toasted Challah. Cammomille. Raw sugar. Clementines. Lilacs. Chanterelles. Slightly spicy but well rounded finish. More complex than anticipated. The cask draft opens up the flavors quite a bit.
Olor escaso. Buen cuerpo. Poca espuma sin consistencia. Sabor ligero pero amargo. Esta bien.

Cerveja alaranjada,espuma cremosa alta e duradoura;aroma cítrico aparecendo casca de laranja,abacaxi,com malte e um leve caramelo ao fundo;sabor agridoce,embora os lúpulos cítricos continuem em destaque ao um perfeito equilíbrio com a base maltada,corpo médio,final seco,frutado e com suave amargor,refrescante e gostosa convidando para um novo gole. Boa cerveja de uma boa cervejaria.
Pours clear amber with slight head. Nose with notes of bread and citrus. Nice medium full mouthfeel. Bready malt flavours followed up by decent bitterness. Nice ale

Ambar bonito, clara pero no del todo. Espuma contenida y no muy duradera aunque deja película. Aroma ligero. Entre frutal y caramelo. En boca es fantástica. Lo tiene todo. Cuerpo, cremosidad, punto de carbonatacion, calor alcoholico en el posgusto, y excelente equilibrio entre una malta acaramelada exquisita y un lupulo frutal y que además le confiere una redondez seca, que hace el conjunto nada pesado. Chapeaux!
Bottle, 50 cl, The Bombardier, Paris. Overall pleasant ale, well balanced, not too hoppy, short bitter finish.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2015 Copper liquid, moderate head. Bisquits, cake, fruity& grassy english hop on nose. Medium body. Quaffable. Well balanced taste of caramel, bisquits, grassy & piny hops. Medium bitteress. Long hoppy finish. Very good

Cor de ouro envelhecido com tom alaranjado, cristalina e brilhante; espuma marfim de média intensidade e alta persistência (permanece camada espessa até o fim da degustação) e muito bom lacing.
Aroma maltado com dulçor agradável e leve toque de banana.
Sabor de caramelo com final amargo intenso bem inserido e seco muito bem equilibrado; retrogosto adstringente.
Corpo médio e baixa carbonatação.
Exclente drinkability. Perfeito exemplar de cerveja inglesa.
Pours a clean medium cooper with a small white head. Aroma is sweet apple/pear. Apple notes in taste with a small spicy bitter finish.

Po nalaniu tworzy się biała, zbita czapa piany z ładnym lejsingiem, barwa jasno bursztynowa, klarowna. Aromat delikatny, jest chmiel dość trawiasty, troszkę karmelu, melanoidyn, drewna i zapachów whisky. Generalnie troszkę ubarwiony ESB. W smaku lekka słodycz miodowo karmelowa, biszkopty, skórka od chleba skontrowane średnią do niskiej ziołowo trawiastą goryczką, lekko garbnikową w afterteasie. Nagazowanie średnie, dość pełne w odbiorze, alkohol obecny, aczkolwiek dobrze ukryty, rozgrzewający w przełyku. 
Piwo jest bardzo angielskie, dość męczące na dłuższą metę i choć jest troszkę bogatsze w doznania sensoryczne to mimo wszystko blisko mu do typowego nudnego brytyjskiego ESB.
Cor bronze, brilhante. Espuma boa e de média persistência. Aroma Herbalife é frutas secas. Paladar lúpulo e condimentos. Retrogosto amargo e seco. Esperava mais.....
Bottle from SJ. Some nice notes of citrus, spice, caramel and bread. Mild hop finish with a zesty pop. Not bad.

Dark golden to copper colored, medium white head which quickly disappears leaving only lacing. Aroma is malts, caramel and biscuit, a touch of fruits and floral hops. Taste is moderate sweet malts, again caramel and biscuit, bit fruity, bit of lightly toasted bread in the finish and some floral, grassy hops with a pinch of citrus, low to medium dry bitterness and a bitter aftertaste. Medium bodied.

A mid copper brown coloured beer with a frothy but weak white head. A light hop led aroma, zesty citrus fruit is followed by a mildly spicy caramel malt. Dry mouthfeel. The taste is opposite to the aroma, a dry, biscuity, slightly spicy and caramel malt to start, is followed by a zesty, citrusy and grassy hop flavour. The finish is zesty and hop led, but with a background maltiness creates a well balanced end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Barva: zlatooranová, pěna bohatá, drící. Vůně: příjemná svěí, lehká, citrusová. Chuť: parádní hořký nástup, přiměřený říz, kávová chuť se stopou čkolády (hořké) dlouhá doznívající chmelová hořkost. Parádní pivo!

Po otwarciu butelki wita mnie gushing Nie jakiś straszny, ale jednak (z powodu nieumiejętnej refermentacji w butelce). Zapach jest słodowy i estrowy, choć trudno mi w tej chwili skojarzyć go jakimiś konkretnymi owocami. Są też delikatne nuty chmielowe. Piwo jest w kolorze bursztynowe, leciuteńko tylko zamglone. Brown 500ml bottle, best before 31st May 2009, drank mid Jan 2009.

The yeast aroma from the head was very powerful and it overshaddowed the hops and malt smells trying to get out, very impressive.

Sampled at LAutre Oeil in Aylmer, Quebec. Bottle conditioned with a best before date that reads: 13 Apr 07 (originally rated December 2006). Poured a slightly hazy, clean (no sediments) amber colour. Beautiful creamy off-white head with excellent retention and decent lacing rings all-around. Nice fruity citrus nose with good hop. Full-bodied mouthfeel with a dry aftertaste. Had a metallic start, but disappeared quickly after the first sip. Great hoppy bitterness with the fruit (grapefruit, orange). Not sweet because of the hop though. Extremely well-brewed ale with the perfect balance between bitterness and fruity. Quite a refreshing brew... and was great with the nachos we had there.

Yes, a great one! Im glad that i taste it. Beautiful copper, well-balanced body with a nice lacing head. Intensive aroma of fresh fruits (citrus, orange) and an overwhelming healing taste. Mildly pungent palate, nice for an ale. A bit dry yeasty impact. It reminds me to the Belhavens Twisted Thiste. Once more: great one, or as Duke Ellington would say: Thats the one!

500ml bottle. Pours a hazy amber gold, with a small, but long-lasting, head. The aroma is dominated by strong resin notes from the hops, with the slightest hint of malty toffee. The initial flavour is again resin hops, which fade into the slightest hint of caramel malt before returning with a vengeance in the finish, which is again dominated by bitter hops. There is a slight toffee aftertaste. A truly magnificent beer: rich, rewarding and complex. Well-worth savouring again and again.
50cl bottle@ Silja Symphony. Poured amber color with a thin head, some lacing. Aroma is very hoppy and fruity. Flavor is dry hoppy, bit malty and citrus fruits. Quite smooth, ends very bitter.
Pours a cloudy orange in the glass. Nose and taste of bitter hops, sugar and caramel. Rated 11/3/2000

This ale produces a hazy, orange body with a dense, creamy white head. Looks delicious. Smell is butterscotch and light malts, with a hint of hoppy zest in the back. Taste is bitter grapefruit hops and smooth butterscotch malts, with some hints of banana along the way. Drinkable and yet a bit staunch, Youngs Special London Ale is an assertive beer which, after a few sips, also proves to be quite filling. Nice and smooth palate. Bitter citric aftertaste. A really good ale, all in all.

Copper color with an off- white head. Brown sugar, caramel, ginger, wood, malts in the aroma. Medium dense, full rounded body that is smooth on the palate. Clear, low carbonation. Sugary sweetness with no alcohol taste. A hint of hoppy aftertaste. Decent.

Bottle. Deep copper orange with a foamy white head. Very fruit hop aroma of apricot and peach with caramel malt . Flavour is fruity - predominantly apricot but with some banana. Some sweetness of caramel and nutty-like flavours, changing to a tangy sourness. Bitterness is quite sharp and the finish is dry. Full bodied. Hmm...really like this but something just wasnt right with the balance. The flavours dont come together all that well. Despite that....still very enjoyable.
Aroma of honey, tart apple and sweet toffee. Appearance was translucent gold with creamy head. Flavor matches the nose, pretty sweet really. Palate is creamy. Pretty good U.K. beer.

Rézszínű ale, tetején egy közepes, finom és szép tömött, a pohár szélén (is) megmaradó, habbal ill. közepes szénsavassággal mutatja magát.
Illata elsőre intenzív és trópusi gyümölcsöket idéz fel bennem, idővel a komló fűszeressége és a jfelsőerjesztésű élesztő is feltűnik.
Enyhe csípősséggel indít, íze igen édes, gyümölcsös, malátás, mely selymesen terül szét a szájban.
Aromájában elsősorban a citrusos komló uralkodik, egy kis karamellával kiegészítve.
Befejezése erőteljesen fűszeres, citrusos és száraz, mely szépen kiszárítja a szájpadlást, és kellemes (fűszeres) utóízt hagy maga után.
Testén az idő múltával érezhető a magasabb alkoholtartalom, de ettől még nem válik nehézzé. Jól kiegyensúlyozott, remek ser volt ez.

Bottle.

Fruit, grass, hops in the aroma, taste of fruit, citurs, malt and some bread. Aftertaste of nuts. A little bit thin and not much carbonation. Drinkable but boring in the long run.

Világosabb rézvörös színű enyhén homályos ital,amit egy hófehér apró buborékos hab takar be,aminek közepes mérete van,ami hamarosan vékony csíkká fogy és szinte örök életű.Illata olyan mintha egy vidéki gyümölcsösben sétálnánk ami éppen tavasszal virágba borul.Ízében érezni egy adag virágmézet,almát,dupla adag finom malátát és annál is több virágos komlót.Olyan mintha egy kis fenyőgyanta is lenne benne de kellemesen és nem bántóan.Harapni lehet és a fajtának megfelelően enyhén pezsgő.Utóíze grapefruitos,száraz,étvágygerjesztően kesernyés.Fantasztikus ale amit bármikor és bárhol lehet élvezni!Fantasztikus!

Appearance: Somewhat cloudy, deep coppery orange tinted pour with an impressive, cottony white head.

Aroma: Attractive pine-oily, ginger or coriander-like resinous hop perfume gently tickles the nose.

Flavor: Dry, bittersweet grapefruity hops greet the taste buds. Just a subtle hint of caramel/crystal(?) malty sweet interruption before the lingering grapefruity, piney sensation.

Mouthfeel/Palate: Slightly viscous, smooth and oily body. Dry, refreshing palate.

Overall: Impressive english ale with a strong reminescent of some dry-hopped american IPA-s. Tastful and memorable stuff.

0,5 l bottle, Csakajosor.
Hazy amber colored beer with a delicious creamy lacing white-off white head.Nice citrussy- resiny hop with a fine malt backgound in the nose. The caramel and  the malt based body opens slowly with a good balanced citrussy and resiny hop character. Some honey and a bit of vanilla. Pleasant spicy, well rounded, smooth mouthfeel. Yumm, that was delicious!

Bottle 500ml. Very enjoyable. Aromas of apple, caramel, toffee, and a touch of alcohol. Taste is sweet, with bitterness taking over for a long finish. Medium bodied, with high gravity and a silky mouth feel. Amber, with a thin frothy head.

Young & Company Brewery, P.L.C.--Ram Brewery Wandsworth--Special London Ale

2001 16.9 oz. Bottle.  6.40% ABV.  (3.25 / 5.0)  Winter Ale.  Purchased,Tasted, Reviewed in London.  Did Not Bring Home.  Saved Label.  Sampled 12/7/2001.

2005 16.9 oz. Bottle.  6.40% ABV--20 IBUs.?  (4.25 / 5.0)  ESB?  Mild lacy head.  Bottle Conditioned.  Clear bright rich amber color.  Mild fruit ester earthy hop front.  Tangy mild earthy sweet fruit yeast ester no stank caramel bisquit body.  Zesty mild earthy clean hop spice ESB end.  Sampled 7/6/2006.

50 cl bottle. Deep amber, reddish-orange tints. Tall, very fine head. Strong hop aroma. Fruity and dry. Fully malty flavor, a touch of sweetness and fruit, but with lots of hops as well. Medium to heavy-ish body. Great flavor. A strong hop finish, quite bitter and long lasting, with a bit of sweet malt in there as well. A great beer, very good in all respects, though not amazingly original or new. Still excellent.

Bottle.

A - Light orange amber color. Large, bubbly, foamy white head. Good retention with a decent amount of lacing left.

S - A bit of caramel malt as well as some fruit (apple, lemon, and orange). Slight hop smell.

T - A fair amount of caramel and toffee malt. Also a good amount of bready taste. Some fruit flavors, a lot of apple and a little berry. Also a good amount of lemon taste. Good amount of hops that are pretty prominent. Floral, herbal, and earthy taste. Good balance. Finishes with a little bit of a mineral and medicinal taste.

M - Medium body with slightly above average carbonation. Slight chewy feel, but smooth overall.

D - Very drinkable beer. The body is full but not overly filling, and it goes down easy. There are plenty of taste with a new combination each sip.

Notes: Really nice balanced beer. Not as bitter as other ESBs, but definitely is as tasty and drinkable as other ones (ABV is a little high for a session type beer though). Lots of balanced crisps flavors that I would gladly drink again. Solid beer that isnt too light or too heavy.
Uncelar golden of color with a off white head. An aroma of bread, hops, apples, fruits, weak bitter notes and flowers. A flavor of bread, grainy, hops, apples, flowers, weak spice and a fresh finish.

Copper color, medium-sized white head; aroma of roquefort cheese, fruits and hops; medium body, smooth carbonation; sweet caramel malty flavor with good spicy hoppy finish. Close to perfection in terms of balance and a great example of british ale.

500ml bottle (London Pub, Helsinki) (7-4-7-4-15=3.7)
Lovely fruity hoppy aroma, peach and mango in abundance, sweetish malts and light caramel backdrop too. Crisp carbonation - has BCd quite well. Lovely malty palate, roast is gentle and a touch caramelly. Damn, those fruity hops are everywhere, not as citrussy as new world ones, but stickier fleshier ones. And the bitterness is lovely too, leaving a lovely tasty finish. Covers 6.4% brilliantly, I could session this.
Rerate of: 500ml bottle (Kings Arms, Oxford - as 400th Anniversary Ale specially for the pub)
Anna - wheres my rating?

500mL bottle.  Pours a clear gold with almost no head.  Floral hoppy aroma with undertones of honey.  Medium sweetness and bitterness, slightly toasty flavour with a bit of alcohol.  Medium bodied, soft carbonation and reasonably creamy on the palate with a nice bitter and slightly fruity acidic finish.
A clear brown / dark amber beer with a large long lasting white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Strong fruity malt flavours with a nice bitter finish. Great beer. - 500mm brown bottle.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 A dark  amber beer with a white creamy head mostly lasting. Aroma is malty, hoppy (fruity and spicy). Full body. Flavour is mainly sweet carmel malt with notes of fruit and mild spice. Dry and fruity bitter in the lingering finish. It is a very tasty beer.

From a 500ml bottle on 24/1/2010. The nose is spicy hops and toasty malts, which gives more than a hint of vast array of flavours to follow - fruit, spice, caramel and toffee to name but a few. It has a little bit of a Belgian ale character to it, though with a very distinct personality of its own. An extremely complex, and most impressive ale.

13th December 2008. Hazy gold brown beer. Creamy malt with a nice crisp hop profile that provides some dark orange but no bitterness. This blends well with malt providing some additional orange cream flavour. Dry finish. A pleasant surprise!
not a bad beer, very easy drinking. nice malt profile, caramelish in part, not overly bitter finish, very sessionable
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden and slightly hazy. Aroma and taste are malt, hops, grass and notes of caramel.

Bottle. Pours a deep golden orange with slight haze. Small creamy white head that disappears pretty quickly leaving lots of lacings. Aromas of malt, fruity hops, caramel and a little marmalade and light stone fruits. Tastes of biscuity malt with more of the marmalade and tropical fruits. Pine / resiny hops tastes are not overpowering but certainly present. Not overly bitter finish. Mouth feel is very creamy. Certainly an easy drinking beer.

500 ml bottle. From m/s Silja Serenade.
Deep golden colour with tiny white head.
Bitter fruity aroma with caramel.
Lots of toffee/caramel in bitter fruity flavour.
Some sugary sweetness.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2014 [12/09] Bottle. Copper, small beige head, low bead. Grapefruit, earth, leaves on the nose. Oily texture. Not very vibrant orchard fruits. Hop bitterness is not at all biting, but is persistent. As is often the case for me with these sorts of beers, this mainly reminds me of how much better its lighter cousins are near home poured from the cask. But its pretty good. [3.6] [1/14] In date bottle. An unpleasant soapiness in this one along with harsh spices. Perhaps a badly kept bottle. 2.5? [9/14] Seems so - this one is fine despite being close to BB.
A fabulous beer with a bit a dig.  An ideal refreshment after a hard day at work. The ale has real gravity and bite, but too many in one session is not recommended!

(Br-btl, Bl/R/G-lbl, aged 4y)

gold, no head, ^co2, fruity hoppy §bitter T1&T2, hoppy T3, afternoon beer

Bottle, Tesco. Fine copper coloured crisp, yet slightly sweet beer. Despite the move of brewery, it has retained its papery tang and citrus notes. A high quality BCA, with good carbonation and a nice bitter, peppery finish.
Hoppy flowery aroma. Hazy golden amber color and medium lacy sticky head. Sweet malty with generous flowery hops. Overwhelming dry hop finish. Balanced and original. Good beer
Deep amber colour witha  lovely malt driven aroma. very clean flavours with malt and well balanced hops. A very enjoyable English beer, one of my favourtie from Wells and Youngs stable of fine ales.

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber-golden with a firm off-white head. Good lacing. Crisp pine hop aroma with faint metallic notes mucking about in the background. Malty notes as it warms. Flavour is crisp pine hops with malt in the background. Bitter hop finish. Nice. 22-10-09.

500ml bottle from First Choice liquor stores. Appears in a pint glass as a translucent amber beer with a medium white head that provides decent lacing. The nose is malty with a floral/herbal hops and a whiff of alcohol. The palate is multi-layered and complex with flavours of marmalade, dried apricots, peaches and rich malts before finishing with a big peppery hop presence that lingers. Nicely smooth and drinkable with the ABV well hidden. A top class bottle-conditioned ale.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy golden amber with a short off-white head. Aroma is quite malty and has notes of citrus, caramel and some tropical fruit. Flavour is fairly similar with an additional woodiness, a hint of apricot and some of the hops coming through at the end. A very good beer with a medium to full body and a nice lingering finish, highly sessionable.

Bottiglia da 50cl allExultate, una discreta ale di Youngs senza troppe particolarità nel bene o nel male (poco amaro, ma era tanto che non bevevo Youngs quindi può darsi che non sia poi unanomalia della birra quanto una caratteristica del produttore) la gradazione elevata per lo stile - alla fine è una bitter un po più spinta - non dà fastidio, anzi quasi non si avverte.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2009 50cl bottle. This "real ale" has a beautiful, hazy amber colour, with a smallish, creamy off-white head that disappears rather quickly but leaves lacing on the glass. The aroma is rather sweet, of fig, citrus fruit and malt. The fruity character extends to the taste, nicely balanced by a resinous note of roasted malt. Long hoppy finish and aftertaste. A strong premium ale that does not wear the alcohol on its sleeve, so to speak. Beautifully balanced, eminently well-crafted, superbly drinkable beer.

Gold/amber with a white head.6.4%? Theyve done pretty well hiding that. Its fairly standard but near the top end of that scale. Malt and hops, little caramel and a little fruit. Not much really but if there was nothing else in the pub, wouldnt be unhappy drinking this for a night. Good session beer.

Smells like a very typical bitter, but no heavy alcohol or water notes, which is a good thing, but nonetheless quite average. Looks okay but needs way more head, whatever there was disappeared too darned quick. Has a nice smooth taste, lots of nutty notes, some caramel, but not very complex. Good mouthfeel. Not a bad beer, pretty good for a high alcohol bitter, decent for a night at a pub and a footie game.
A very nice ale, with colour and aroma to match.  Retained only the slightest head after a sip or two, and features a superior taste/flavour.  Washed down a LARGE choclate brownie quite handily.
Bottle. Pitchers Pub Västerås. Dark golden/orange colour. Maltiness, caramel, oranges, spicy hops, light alcohol.

500ml bottle. Deep orange in colour with a wispy side order of faom floating on top. Aromas of bubblegum and banana lollies with a lively zing in the mouth and a bitter aftertaste. Smooth and drinkable with a spicy hop finish.

Bottle. Pours with a huge white head over an orange-amber body. Tastes and smells of dried spices (coriander?), marmalade and tropical fruits with a delightful hoppy resinous-spicy bitterness. Really enjoyable.

Bottled.
Amber with withe head. Aroma of malt and hop spices. Flavor is caramel and spices.

Bottle from Waitrose. I have not tried this beer since it moved away from its namesake town and I dont intend to either. Orange/copper colour with nettle and pepper hop aroma. Lovely body with silky malts and ample balancing english hop bitterness. Fruity and packed with flavours.
500ml Bottle - Amber/orange in colour with a slight haze. Hoppy aroma with grapefruit and biscuity malt. Fruity and hoppy taste with caramel, grapefruit and a hint of sweetness.

Slightly hazy, dark burnt orange brew with 1" of tan cap. Man, the colour is great! Decent retention and some slippery ropy lacing. The aroma is awesome and I wavered giving it a 10. Strong fragrant fruity / spicy hops (a mix of dark and citrus fruits). Biscuit and a bit of caramel malts. Best ever? Pretty much. The taste is biscuit and caramel with a large presence of spicy hops. The impression of alcohol is made without really noticing it. The flavour wanes during warming as the aroma was more dominant than the taste, especially early on. Cocoa and lots of pepper. Stiff bitterness prevails. A good smooth carbonation paves the way for the malty middle but that malts weakens significantly at the end of the sip. Near medium bodied. The hops hit with a good spicy burn (alc?) to finish you off. Excellent beer.
Tasted great after a long work week.  Just a shame its not available in too many places around me.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2011 RE8. (bottle conditioned )This ale sticks out from the  crowd of Youngs beers in their safe profolio, & has some fucking balls.   Hops are bright , fruity (orange  zest)  and vibrant.  Malt plays along as a spine.   Classy & full of light  . Just as enjoyable as its former local city rival 1845 in bottled conditioned turf war .

50cl bottle found in fakta allerød.
clear orange / light amber, small thick offwhite head.
sweet, flowery, quite hoppy aroma, faint pine, faint grapefruit - very american for an english beer. nice. aroma is mild, balanced and lovely.
flavor is dry, pine, flowery, hoppy, refreshing. very nice.
overall definetly one of the best mainstream english beers ive had. thirstquencing, tasty and good ABV. nice!. ends rather discrete with a little hop bitterness and some malty flavors.

Dark golden brown body with a noisy off white cap, retention is ok but no lacing what so ever. Aroma very mild and hard to detect but honey and bready malts are noticeable. Wood and mild rubbing alcohol are the first flavours I notice, secondary flavours are liquorish, caraway seeds, and maybe honey. Mouth feel is light a nicely carbonated but a burning sensation remains on my tung. Very clean and crisp and enjoyable you cant go wrong with this beer.
Bottle. Pours amber with a medium white head. Aroma of caramel malt, fruit and earthy notes. The flavour is caramel malt, fruit and hops. Medium bodied and finishes sweet and bitter.
A nice fresh mineral aroma with resinous overtones. It has beautiful honey colour and rocky head. Flavours of citrus fruit followed by a linguering hoppy and slightly alcoholic finish. Very nice.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2009 Smells strangely like the paint thinner I used to use on my model airplanes. This beer is strange and with a sour taste which my experience can only compare to a Flemish Sour Ale such as Rodenbach. Very pleasant, interesting, and quite unique / rare.Sometimes you might taste a hint of banana, but mainly it is the acidic orange flavour, often leaving a slightly bitter aftertaste. Not quite as good as Rodenbach, as it seems like the peels of the oranges were used a bit too much, leaving too much bitterness.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2009 500 ml bottle. Light brown/amber body with a medium off-white head. A very delicate aroma of malt, caramel and citric fruity hops. Flavor is mild and balanced malt, caramel and fruity bitterness. Nice and smooth bitter finish. Well made.
Flaske: Superlækker diskret citrus slår en i møde fra denne lækre øl. Smagen er velhumlet på en god karamel maltbase der gør at øllen virkelig glider ned. Dejlig øl.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2010 (bottle) pours a clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of fruity, slightly citric hops, honey, bread and sweet spices. flavour is the same, with a spicy dry grainy character and a slightly bitter fruity hop finish. medium body and carbonation.

bottle. Small fizzy white head that mostly diminished. Spare display of lacework. Light cloudy golden color. Sweet fruit, light ash, grass, mild toasted malt, nutty, floral. Medium bodied, average carbonation, light dry texture. Moderated sweet and bitter flavor. Light bitter dry ash, flower grass finish.

Bottled(500ml). -Dark orange coloured, small to medium white head, aromatic flowery hoppy nose with hint of fruit. Moderate malty, citrusy hoppy and fruity taste with mild spicy notes. Pleasant ale, but like Marko said, far from greatness.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with ogivlado who found it in Wien (thanks!). Poured an orange body with a small thick white head that went away fast. Citrusy, fruity aromatic hoppy nose, some malty notes too.  Earthy maltiness and citrusy aromatic hopiness = the taste. Light notes of beets. Refreshing but just ok, doesnt impress me as much as it perhaps should. Light bitter aftertaste. Its a good beer but far from greatness.
Bottle from Sainsburys.  Clear gold/orange colour with frothy white head.  Slight flowery aroma.  Fruity malt taste.  Full bodied and a pleasantly long, bitter finish.  Very good.
Cloudy golden with a small off-white head. Aroma of grassy hops with fruity notes. Dry and hoppy flavour with a touch of alcohol
Pours a very handsome golden colour with a clean white head. Crisp hop aroma. Excellent British pint flavour. This is damn good! :-)

I was really looking forward to trying this beer.  It has won numerous awards for it bottle conditioning.

I have to say it wasnt quite to my taste.  I found the aroma quite fresh but a bit to fruity.  The same with the taste.  I like the fruit flavours brought through the hop,  but this was just too much for me. 

On the up side it is quite a smooth creamy beer to drink and the aftertaste is quite good.

Wanted to like it, but cant say I did.

Bottle, Sainsburys, Upton. This was a favourite about 6 years ago whilst I was living in London, but the quality seems to have dropped over the passage of time. Maybe leaving Wandsworth for Bedford has torn the body and soul out of it??
Orangey amber colour, thin white head. Aroma was hoppy, slightly perfumey and soapy, qualities which progressed into the flavour. Also present was a fair amount of fruit and malt mixed with a damp woody tang. Some nice aspects to this, but lacking real bite , and whilst pleasant enough I was left somewhat underwhelmed
bottle, deep orange color, only a faint head, aroma of banana and apple cider, flavor of malt, spice, applesauce and fruit cocktail, bright metallic finish

Pours slightly cloudy brown/orange. Off white head. Apple, malty aromas. Some spice present. Taste is suitably full bodied, with a bitterness well balanced with a sweetish malt. Spice and apples are subtle. The finish is long and dry.

Crystal clear copper with a frothy white head.  Aroma of grass, light pine, some citrus, and some malt as well.  Grass seems to overwhelm the flavor.  Its not that its strong, but its the strongest thing there.  Nice sweet malts, as well.  Light bitter finish.  Easy to drink and pretty solid.
Bottle. Nice hops aroma. Slightly unclear amber colour with beige head. Well balanced between malt sweetness and hops bitterness. Long lasting a bit fruity aftertaste.
Golden amber with a white head and lacing. Strange musty flavour with citrus hop flavours. Decent palate. Not how I remember it from a year or two ago :(
Bottle. Bit hazy golden amber body with a long lasting white head. Fruity and yeasty aroma. Fruity aroma with a good hoppiness and some spices from the yeast. Hoppy and malty aftertaste. Great brew.
Malty slightly sour nose. Pale beige head. Slightly hazy pale golden brown colour. Soft fruity and slightly metallic taste. At the end hopiiness. Grasssy hop taste. Slightly sweet tatse.

Hazy orange beer with a minimal white head. Thin white lacing is quite long lasting. Aroma is hoppy, fresh piney and slightly toffy. Distinctive Goldings hop character is slightly floral, citric, spicy and piney. Flavor is medium bitter and toffy malts are included. Palate is medium bodied, tongue-numbing and bitter. Clean and and easy ale.
Bottle. Conditioned. Pours a hazy gold colour  with a orange tint. Nice big off white head that diminishes quickly. Big sweet aroma. Bitter taste with a pleasantly crisp and dry finish.

Pours with a snowy white, nicely lingering head, strong aroma of malts fighting through the fluff...this beer to look at is slightly lighter than I would normally go for but was swayed by the bottle conditioned tag on the bottle and was rewarded by the toffee and caramel in the mouth, it has real complexity with lots of different things but not one overpowering

Bottle, bought @ Irma, Industriens Hus, Cph.
Pours hazy golden amber with a fine, staying, creamy, off-white head. Aroma is sweet, lots of malts, some toffee and good flowery hops. Medium carbonation, fine, lightly dry mouthfeel. Flavour is wonderful. Lots of toffee, a bit of burnt caramel, good, dryish flowery bitterness. A touch of metal perhaps, but the beer is maybe just served a tad too cold. Long, lingering aftertaste with a heacy hops presence. This is really enjoyable.

Solid ale, with a well dden alcholic presence. Pours from the bottle with a beautiful wispy two finger head. Lovely muddy orange colur. Balanced with a minimal hoppy finish. enjoyable on a cool autumn evening
Bottle. Dark amber colour with a medium sized white head. Flowery hoppy aroma. Medium-bodied and well-balanced. Hoppy flavour with some malts and bitter finish. Quite nice ale.

Pulled this review out from a while ago...
Served at cellar temperature in glass. Woe is me and getting beers with dates. Toffee malt notes dominate the nose, has a sort sharpness to it too which always seems to indicate it’s a bit old. Clear amber body with a washy white head and lacing. Flavour is slightly sweet, toffeeish malt, hints of hop floralness, not much though. Slight bitter dry ending. Not bad but not outstanding.
Beautiful foggy orange color with a good white head. Nice hoppy fresh aroma. Fruity, hoppy flavor with bitter aftertaste.
Knew this was good as the floral and citrus came off the nose.  Murky colour with not much of a head.  Citrus and spice with modest grip.  Nice beer.
50cl Bottle from Cracked Kettle. Cloudy amber beer, white head. Aroma of hops, caramel, malts, sour fruits. Flavour is fruity and very hoppy, a bit spicy. Nice bitterness, bitter finish.

Bottle. dark amber color with white head. 
Flavor has some caramel, fruits and hops. 
Sharp taste of pine that im not too fond of.
Finish is nice with some peppers.

500ml bottle-conditioned. Piney and vinous nose with a hint of pepper. Small tight head. Malty and smooth on the tongue wih an alcohol prickle, building quickly to a full-bodied malty and spicey taste. The aftertaste is bitter-sweet with peppery hops.
500 ml bottle. Amber color, white head. Piny hop aroma. Lasting bitterness, full-bodied, smooth mouthfeel. Not half bad.

Pours a hazy amber, aroma of muted malts and dusty hops.
palate is spicy hop heavy with a robust malt backbone, bitter and slightly agricultural finish, very pleasant.

Decent special bitter. A little too much residual sweetness for my liking. Not hoppy enough to balance out the sweet edge either. The hop nose was there, but it didn’t carry through to the mouth. An enjoyable pint nontheless, but not, in my opinion in the Fullers ESB class.

Hazy amber, nice lasting white head. Biscuit malty nose, nice strong grapefruity hops, very smooth and balanced. Similar flavor, mostly grapefruit, just not as fresh as the aroma. Strong seedy bitterness. Medium bodied, smoothly carbonated palate. Maybe a bit simple, but pleasing as hell. If you happen to like that sort of stuff.

1pt 0.9oz bottle from Bayville Package Store, Fenwick Island, DE...amber pour, white head...aroma of malts, hops, floral...taste is hops, citrus, grass, bit metallic...really good, but the aftertaste was like wet sponge...I think I got too much sediment off the bottom.
dark amber color, fluffy, subsiding head, nice lacing.  aroma of airy hops, malt, grain.  flavor is mildly dry with creamy notes.  medium bodied, dry creamy finish.  possibly a nice session beer.
I didn’t really get this beer. Just had a very dry earthy aroma. Flavor was dry and earthy as well. Both were very mild. Just wasn’t a whole lot there, was looking for more.

Bottle.  Aroma of caramel malt, fruit and mineral hops.  Dark murky brown amber hue with an average sized off-white head that mostly diminished and left some lace.  Flavor is of caramel malt, orange zest, mineral hops.  Palate is medium-full bodied and oily soft.
